name: Instant Pot Chicken Paprikash
description: You have the choice to prepare this chicken paprikash either using an Instant Pot or a stovetop. Regardless of your chosen method, it will be ready in under half an hour! You're welcome to experiment with paprika varieties; I, for instance, incorporated three distinct types: smoked paprika, sweet paprika, and the standard version of paprika.

name: Tuscan Black Pepper Beef
description: According to the tale, laborers crafting terracotta tiles in Impruneta, Tuscany, would put this hearty stew into clay pots and let it simmer in the kilns, where it would be perfectly cooked by the following morning. Due to the variable quality of the meat, they generously seasoned it with pepper. The quantity of pepper is your personal choice—I, for example, used quite a generous amount, yet it remained pleasantly balanced and not overwhelming.
ingredients: 6 beef short ribs (8 to 10 oz. each)
salt to taste, to adjust sauce

name: Bibimbap
description: This recipe for bibimbap offers a delightful and well-loved Korean dish. Bibimbap, which translates to 'mixed rice,' consists of a flavorful rice bowl adorned with an assortment of vegetables, beef, a whole egg, and gochujang, a red chili pepper paste. Historically, bibimbap was savored on the night preceding the Lunar New Year, as a way to enjoy any remaining ingredients before welcoming the new year
ingredients: ¼ cup gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste) (Optional)
1 bunch fresh spinach, cut into thin strips
1 pound thinly-sliced beef top round steak
2 teaspoons gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste), divided (Optional)

name: Baked Ziti
description: This baked ziti is consistently well-received! A colleague of mine introduced this dish one day, and it received high praise from everyone. Since then, it has become the top choice among my dinner guests. I have also prepared it without meat, and it was equally enjoyed.

name: John Wayne Casserole
description: Everyone at your table is sure to enjoy the hearty and filling John Wayne casserole. Despite its name, the John Wayne Casserole was not created by the actor but rather by a cookbook published as a fundraiser.
ingredients: 1 medium red bell pepper, halved and sliced (1 1/2 cups)
1 (4 ounce) jar sliced jalapeno peppers, drained (Optional)

name: Elote Pizza
description: The characteristics of Mexican street corn, including corn, chili-lime spice, jalapenos, cheese, and crema, are combined in this grilled elote pizza, which is enhanced by being baked on a grill.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons olive oil, or as needed
2 tablespoons sour cream, plus more for drizzling
2 teaspoons chili lime seasoning, such as Tajin® Clasico, divided
1 jalapeno, very thinly sliced, or more to taste

name: Skillet Meatballs
description: These meatballs may be used in spaghetti, soup, sandwiches, or as an appetizer because they are soft on the inside and tasteless.

name: Shrimp and Pepper Stir-Fry
description: The star of this straightforward yet vibrant stir-fry with loads of vegetables are shrimp and peppers. Serve with rice noodles or steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips
1 yellow bell pepper, cut into thin strips
1 1/2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined

name: Chicken Adobo
description: Everyone who tries it loves the traditional chicken adobo dish since it is so easy to prepare. It is wonderful when served over rice and is somewhat saucier than regular adobo.
ingredients: ⅔ cup low sodium soy sauce

name: Ham, Potato and Broccoli Casserole
description: This casserole is excellent, simple to prepare, and packed with nutritional value. You have the option to include macaroni pasta or experiment with seasoning the potatoes before baking. Store this dish in the freezer and cook it whenever you don't feel like preparing a meal from scratch. It's also adaptable for using leftover cooked chicken.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

name: Moussaka
description: The moussaka is absolutely delicious! It involves layers of thinly sliced eggplant that are baked within a seasoned ground beef mixture, topped with a rich and creamy white béchamel sauce, making it a quintessential Greek culinary delight.
ingredients: 3 eggplants, peeled and cut lengthwise into 1/2 inch thick slices
1 ½ cups freshly grated Parmesan cheese

name: Slow Cooker Taco Soup
description: This is an easy-to-make slow cooker soup that's bursting with the flavors you'd typically find in Tex-Mex chili. You can easily customize it to suit your preferences by adding extra taco seasoning or freshly chopped jalapeno peppers for a spicier kick. Adolescents particularly enjoy this soup when garnished with tortilla chips, shredded Cheddar cheese, and a dollop of sour cream.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) can chili beans, with liquid
1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans with liquid
1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, with liquid
2 (14.5 ounce) cans peeled and diced tomatoes
1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers

name: Creamy au Gratin Potatoes
description: These au gratin potatoes are a special occasion every time they are made! The creamy cheese sauce and tender potatoes in this classic French dish make a delicious flavor combination. Serve potatoes au gratin with a roast pork loin or beef tenderloin, alongside a green salad.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste

name: Ahi Tuna Poke
description: This simple poke recipe presents a revitalizing Hawaiian salad featuring fresh ahi tuna steak cubes mixed with soy sauce, sesame oil, and green onions to create a dish brimming with umami taste. Adding chopped macadamia nuts, despite their lack of authenticity, contributes a delightful crunch. This recipe serves 4 as a main course or 8 as an appetizer.
